children.subject: I'm trying to answer the same question (but with EE 126 rather than 151). I am leaning towards taking 161 because a) Weaver and b) I don't like having to pay attention for an hour and a half while sweating in a completely full Pimentel twice a week.

history.content: I'm currently taking 161, but from what I've heard from other people, it is one of the easier upper division courses. The main thing is that the projects will take some time, so budget for that. Nick is also a great professor, so that's also a plus. I wouldn't be worried about the workload though.

I'm currently enrolled in EECS151 (FPGA lab) and CS 168 with Scott Shenker but I'm considering switching out of 168 into 161 with Nicholas Weaver just because the class seems a bit more interesting and projects seem much more hands on and exciting. Can anyone who's taken both of these comment on the relative difficulty of 161? I'm just concerned because 151 is already a beast of a class so I don't necessarily want to take a second upper division technical class that has a fair amount of work/difficulty. Thanks!
history.subject: eecs151 and cs161
